[b][color=white]Ethereum Nosedive[/color][/b]
Cryptocoin Ethereum has taken a nosedive in terms of its value this week. Many people say this is due to the recent hack that took place, involving a hacker that allegedly got his hands on as much as $50 million in Ethereum coins. Ethereum is still planning to take action against this, but many believe this hack has cost the cryptocoin valuable trust that it will not soon regain. Our administrator, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url], has made a thread regarding this as well, you can read up about it here.[i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5328578] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b]

No Announcement Threads have been made this week!

[b][color=white][u]Informational Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5335711][b][Nightmare] Official GFX Helpdesk[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3057494][color=#EFEFEF][b]Acceptable[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]New to graphics? Need assistance with a project? Have no fear, Nightmare's Graphics Help Desk is here!

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5334635][b][HQ-Tutorial] How to Bypass a Cloudflare protected website and get the ip address.[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2866514][color=#EFEFEF][b]kmz22222[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Have you ever wanted to get an IP off of a site but Cloudflare is blocking it? Come read this tutorial now on how to bypass Cloudflare!

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5336174][b][Basic] How To Keep Your PC Clean[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1417209][color=#99FF00][b]Nobody1148[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Everyone can admit that their PC at some point is messy and needs to be cleaned. This is a basic tutorial on how to keep it clean from unneeded programs and files!

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/Interview.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131]Ariana[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[align=center][color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1481636]tornmage[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#ebd3e7][b]Ariana:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome everyone to the 299th edition of the Hack Forums news. Today we have the lovely user, tornmage. Would you like to give any shoutouts before we begin?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1481636][color=white][b]tornmage:[/b][/color][/url] A quick shoutout to my close friend, and the person who actually introduced me to Hack Forums, Clique. He's a stand up guy and contributes great content on a daily basis. That is all.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#ebd3e7][b]Ariana:[/b][/color][/url] He is a good guy indeed. So Tell us about yourself. Who is tornmage?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1481636][color=white][b]tornmage:[/b][/color][/url] I am your average, blue collar dude. I pride myself in my work ethic and drive to help people, if I can. Sometimes in life you just got get out of bed, strap on your work boots, and go to work! It's as simple as that and that's how I live my life.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#ebd3e7][b]Ariana:[/b][/color][/url] I like the way you think my friend. You've been a member since 2012. You've probably seen some ups and downs of the forums. What would you say is your favorite moment and has that impacted your life in anyway?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1481636][color=white][b]tornmage:[/b][/color][/url] It's honestly hard to put my finger on one moment, ari. I would say my four years on Hack Forums in it's entirety. Although I lay pretty low on the forums, I browse often and can honestly say I feel as if I am learning all the time. Hack Forums has taught me so many valuable things.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#ebd3e7][b]Ariana:[/b][/color][/url] You said that Hack Forums has taught you a lot of valuable things. Can you mention what?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1481636][color=white][b]tornmage:[/b][/color][/url] Hack Forums has taught me how to carry myself on the internet which has allowed me to establish "professional" relationships with many users. That is a skillset, learned on HF, that definitely carrys over into my every day life.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#ebd3e7][b]Ariana:[/b][/color][/url] That's really cool to hear. Earlier in the interview you mentioned that someone had recommended you to join this forum. What was it like for you when you first signed up? Were you scared of the high ranking members or nervous in anyway?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1481636][color=white][b]tornmage:[/b][/color][/url] Much like many others before me, I joined Hack Forums in hopes of becoming an elite hacker and soon found out that was not the life path for me. I browsed for quite some time before I made my first post and became aware of the critcism that many new members faced for making low quality posts. That being said, I put a lot of thought into my posts and was slightly intimidated by "high ranking" users.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#ebd3e7][b]Ariana:[/b][/color][/url] I think it's safe to say that when members first join it's a bit nerve–racking for some. I see that you are a member of the Apex Business Sector am I correct? Any specific reason why you joined?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1481636][color=white][b]tornmage:[/b][/color][/url] I saw the Apex Business Sector as an opportunity to establish those professional relationships we spoke of earlier, gain knowledge, and spread my knowledge within a sub-forum. There are definitely some high quality members in that group that I feel like I am learning from and there are some interesting projects coming out that I think Hack Forums will enjoy.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#ebd3e7][b]Ariana:[/b][/color][/url] Are you satisfied with the groups of today? How do they compare to the old ones you remember from the past four years?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1481636][color=white][b]tornmage:[/b][/color][/url] I'm not huge into the whole group scene but I will say this... I think too many group owners approach owning a group as a business move rather than a "help others" or "form companionship's" move. I am disappointed with the skyrocketing price of groups and I think that reflects the attitudes of many group owners. However, I have never been in a situation where I am comfortable spending thousands of dollars on a group so who am I to judge the way group owners handle their business. I'm not saying they are all bad, don't get me wrong, just giving my two cents.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#ebd3e7][b]Ariana:[/b][/color][/url] I would highly agree with that. Last question before we wrap this interview up. Now going way back to the beginning of the interview you stated that you "Sometimes in life you just got get out of bed, strap on your work boots, and go to work". What wise words can you give the members of the forum who are struggling from depression, or let's say, need a little motivation in their lives to feel the same way?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1481636][color=white][b]tornmage:[/b][/color][/url] I developed the majority of my work ethic back when I was playing high school football. My coach, who was actually put into the hall of fame for my state, preached and preached that nothing in life is handed to you. If you want something, chances are you are gonna have to work for it. Don't dread the grind, dont lie and say you enjoy the grind, embrace the grind. Embrace the grind and just accept it as a way of life, as something you have to do, as who you are. If you are gonna get up every morning and do something, you might as well get something out of it. This is a sports-oriented message but it applies to other areas of life. I wasn't thinking about myself when I was playing high school football, I was thinking about the team. I wasn't getting up early and practicing alone, my entire team was doing it with me. Just as you aren't getting up and going to work alone, the world and almost everyone in it is doing it with you. It just has to be done. I've carried these guidelines with me since the moment I learned them, and would encourage anyone reading this to do the same.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#ebd3e7][b]Ariana:[/b][/color][/url] Thank you for taking the time out of your day for this interview. Are there any final words you would like to say?
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1481636][color=white][b]tornmage:[/b][/color][/url] Thank you for your time as well, and thank you for having me on the news Ari. It was a very enjoyable experience.

[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[hr]

[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v2/ScienceNews.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=910913]Intelligent Sin[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[url=http://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2016-07/uotb-tfe070716.php][b][color=white]Neanderthal Cannibalism in Northern Europe[/color][/b][/url]
Neanderthals of the past were once considered to be an extremely primitive, but with new evidence uncovered throughout the years, this has been shown not to be the case. From sites all around the world, we find evidence of neanderthals treating the dead similar to how we do today; for example, we find evidence from sites like Chapelle-aux-Saints in France, and Sima de las Palomas on the Iberian Peninsula, of neanderthals burying the dead. Although, we also find evidence of more primitive practices such as cannibalism. Until recently, Neanderthal cannibalism was thought to be very rare in Northern Europe along with any other evidence for death related practices. The study conducted by the University of the Basque Country has discovered the largest amount of Neanderthal remains in Northern Europe. These remains exhibit signs of cannibalistic practices such as cut marks and heavy pressure to extract marrow from the bone. 

[url=http://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2016-07/uof-wrk070616.php][b][color=white]New Evidence Suggests More Than One Cause for Dinosaur Extinction[/color][/b][/url]
The University of Florida in collaboration with the University of Michigan lead a new study that takes advantage of a new method of reproducing Arctic ocean temperatures to determine what killed the dinosaurs. After putting this new method of reconstruction to use, the team finds that an asteroid impact alone would not have been able to raise Arctic waters to the temperature found. The tool used is called a carbonate clumped isotope paleothermometer, and with this tool, the team is able to analyze the chemical composition of fossil shells in the Arctic ocean. The shells show that the Arctic waters temperature increased roughly 14 degrees Fahrenheit, and when comparing the temperature increase to warming events around the Cretaceous Period, researchers concluded that the extinction of the dinosaurs was most likely due to two of these warming events; one involving volcanic activity and the other with an asteroid impact. 

[url=https://www.sciencenews.org/editors-picks/juno-mission-jupiter][b][color=white]Juno Makes Jupiter Its New Home[/color][/b][/url]
Almost five years ago the Juno spacecraft was launched in hopes that, if successfully reached, it could help us better understand Jupiter. With NASA's Juno probe now in orbit of Jupiter, they plan to leave it there for close to two years. While it is there, the Juno probe will be in charge of helping us uncover the mysteries of the planets interior. After one more cycle of orbit, to make sure all systems are working properly, Juno will become operational. The probes first mission will occur in October of this year; the mission will be series of orbits over the planet's north and south poles.

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/WorldNews.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2110841]Night Fury[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2016/07/03/more-than-100-killed-scores-wounded-in-bombings-across-baghdad.html?intcmp=hpbt1][b][color=white]Suicide Bombing Devastates Baghdad, More Than 100 Killed[/color][/b][/url]
Civilians and law enforcement in downtown Baghdad were hit by a suicide truck bomb on July 3, 2016. The Islamic State group (ISIS) claimed responsibility for the attack. ISIS states it was targeting Shiite Muslims, which comprise the majority of Iraq’s population. According to a police official, at least 115 people were killed, and 187 more were wounded. This was Iraq’s most deadly attack since July 2015. 

[url=http://www.telesurtv.net/english/news/28000-People-Missing-in-Mexico-in-the-last-Decade-Report-20160702-0018.html][b][color=white]More than 28,000 People have gone Missing in Mexico over past Decade[/color][/b][/url]
Since Mexico began its war on drugs, more than 28,000 people have disappeared. This information came to light after the Mexican Commission for the Defense and Promotion of Human Rights released its report on the country. While people disappearing for political causes can be common, the people that disappeared in Mexico were not tied to political or social activism. The most infamous disappearance occurred in 2014 when 43 undergraduate students from the city of Iguala went missing. More than 200 recommendations have been made by non-governmental organizations on how to handle the issue, but the Mexican government has been unresponsive. 

[url=http://hawaiipublicradio.org/post/asia-minute-weight-watching-north-korea][b][color=white]North Korea’s Kim Jong Un Suffering from Weight Complications[/color][/b][/url]
South Korean intelligence reports that Kim Jong Un has recently been putting on a lot of weight. Over the past four years, the supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea gained an additional 30 pounds, which puts him just under 300 pounds. As a result of his obesity, Un is suffering from insomnia and other unidentified weight-related diseases. The leader has apparently been binge eating and drinking due to his stress and fear of safety. North Korean television recently broadcast a shot of Un sleeping at the Supreme People’s Assembly, which sometimes has the consequence of execution if one is not in a high-ranking government position.

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/GamingNews.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=]Buffy Summers[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[b][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/pokemon-go-everything-you-need-to-know/1100-6441555/][color=white]Pokemon Go & Everything You Need to Know![/color][/url][/b]
Pokemon Go released this week and it has upped Nintendo's stock by 10% with its popularity! There are quite a few bugs, including severe server issues, but when you are able to play the game; it is super fun! The game doesn't have much of a tutorial which leaves you with a few questions! Here's what you need to know to maximize your enjoyment while playing the game. The Pokemon that you are able to find are tied to locations by environment and geography. For example, if you're looking for a water Pokemon, your best bet is to check by bodies of water. Poke-Stops, areas that you're able to collect items such as pokeballs and eggs, are tied to landmarks of historical or artistic importance. These Poke-Stops refresh every five minutes with new items! The eggs I mentioned earlier can be a pain for some to hatch as you have to walk anywhere between 2 and 10 km. It is important to note that you can't be riding a bike, car, train, etc because it will not count towards the distance needed to hatch the egg! Evolving Pokemon can be tedious, but it is well worth it! Each Pokemon has a unique CP, Combat Power, freaks! The CP is increased greatly when evolving Pokemon. In order to level and evolve your Pokemon, you need candies and stardust. Both of the aforementioned items are obtained by capturing Pokemon. Each time you capture the same Pokemon, you can transfer it to the professor in this game for the candies needed to evolve your Pokemon. Drowzee's require Drowzee candy, and so on. Having the Pokemon you're walking by doesn't mean anything! Capture it again and level up the one with the greater CP! The subreddit dedicated to Pokemon Go has a great [url=https://www.reddit.com/r/pokemongo/comments/4rvuj2/how_do_i_megathread_part_4/]FAQ[/url] that will also put you ahead in the game!

[b][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/nintendo-files-new-patent-for-a-handheld-device-bu/1100-6441566/][color=white]New Nintendo Handheld Device Might Be in the Works![/color][/url][/b]
A new Nintendo patent for a handheld device has been discovered, though it's too soon to know what the company's plans are for it.The patent was filed for by a number of Nintendo employees with the US Patent & Trademark Office on December 3, 2015, but it was only just published recently, on June 30. It mostly focuses on its speakers and vibration capabilities, but it does also mention a touchscreen. The patent also includes some [url=http://static2.gamespot.com/uploads/scale_super/123/1239113/3091104-n1.jpg]images[/url] which look pretty sleek. However, this is most likely far from the final result. For example, some of the images feature a 3DS circular pad. The full patent with more images can be read [url=http://appft.uspto.gov/netacgi/nph-Parser?Sect1=PTO2&Sect2=HITOFF&p=1&u=%2Fnetahtml%2FPTO%2Fsearch-bool.html&r=1&f=G&l=50&co1=AND&d=PG01&s1=20160192067.PGNR.&OS=DN/20160192067&RS=DN/20160192067]here[/url]. Many argue that Nintendo should just stick to handheld devices after the disaster that the Wii U was and maybe they're shifting there focus in the suggested direction for now!

[b][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/video-game-speedrunning-event-raises-129-million-f/1100-6441657/][color=white]Video Game Speedrunning Event Raises $1.29 Million for Charity[/color][/url][/b]
This year's Summer Games Done Quick, the annual video game speedrunning event, has ended! It was a huge success, raising $1.29 million dollars for the charity of choice this year. It set a new record for SGDQ, beating last year's by nearly a million dollars. Speedrunning is the process of completing a game as quickly as possible. They are particularly fun to watch because they require expert skill, lots of planning, and often the use of exploitable tricks! The speedrun marathon event spanned 160 hours for all games in total. Each of the speedruns can be viewed [url=https://www.youtube.com/user/gamesdonequick]here.[/url]

[align=center]Gaming Video of the Week[sp]

[yt]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LJ2sin-c3Kk[/yt][/sp][/align]

[color=transparent]     [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/HackingNews.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1422600]Fox™[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[url=http://thehackernews.com/2016/07/antivirus-avast-avg.html][b][color=white]Avast to buy Rival Security Firm AVG in a $1.3B Deal[/color][/b][/url]
Security firm Avast Software is planning to acquire its Dutch rival AVG Technologies for $1.3 billion. Avast announced on July 6th that they'd be buying AVG Technologies at $25 per share in an all-cash $1.3 billion transaction. Avast currently has 230 million users worldwide, and provide free and paid services to individuals and businesses on mobile and PCs. The deal will give Avast over 400 million endpoints, 160 million of which are on mobile. With access to a larger number of devices, Avast will have more opportunity to improve their products by having a greater pool of data.

[url=http://thehackernews.com/2016/07/twitter-ceo-hacked.html][b][color=white]Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey Hacked[/color][/b][/url]
In the slew of high-profile Twitter hacks, the CEO of Twitter himself fell victim. Security group OurMine took credit for the hack, after posting benign videos. The team tweeted at 2:50 AM (Eastern Time,) "Hey, its OurMine,we are testing your security," and provided a link to their website that sells their services. While none of the tweets they made were harmful, both the tweet and associated vine were removed shortly after the hack. Some of OurMine's previous Twitter hacks include Google CEO Sundar Pichai, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, Twitter ex-CEO Dick Costolo, and Facebook-owned VR Company Oculus CEO Brendan Iribe.

[url=http://thehackernews.com/2016/07/over-1000-wendys-restaurants-hit-by.html][b][color=white]Over 1,000 Wendy's Restaraunts Hit by Credit Card Hackers[/color][/b][/url]
Fast-food chain Wendy's admitted on Thursday that over 1,000 of their restaurants were hit by a huge cyber attack. They didn't speculate how many people were affected, but they did confirm that the breach allowed hackers to steal customers' credit and debit card information. The hackers used malware installed on PoS (Point-of-Sale) machines to steal the card information. The hack started in the fall of 2015 and Wendy's went public regarding the issue in May. This past month, Wendy's said they learned about a second variant of malware installed on their systems, but they disabled it from "all locations." Wendy's is now offering a free year of "complimentary" fraud protection to all affected customers.

[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239]iHydra[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[i]He is sleeping. It's late at night. She screams.

He runs to her and asks what's the matter, but she just mumbles it's getting better. He goes to bed, and she screams again. Something is happening inside her belly. Something is kicking and punching her from the inside, something that just wants out and start to live. Without trouble, without war, just in peace.

He picks her up and lays her down, back in the car he makes her comfy. The lights are red, but he keeps driving, risking lives for making new. They are upset. The tires squeak, but no one cares once little Timmi sees the light. The light of this world, with all the hate, with all the war, with all the fights, with all the poor, with all the rich, with all the hope that fades and finally get lost in the night.

He is happy, at least everyone thinks, he can't talk, but he can scream, scream so loud that everyone hears, but no one cares because he's cute, but one night, when he turns five, his parents are not at home, and he feels so alone. It's midnight, and he is bored, so he watches TV and swaps programs, nothing he is interested in is running so late at night until the advertisement break comes in. Naked women all over the screen, doing things he has never seen. He goes to sleep and doesn't dream.

He goes to school and tells his friends what he has just seen. They laugh at him and ask him why he didn't know. Attracted to them he should've been. He doesn't know what they could mean; they are just people like anyone else, why should he like them, why should he love them, when they are not as beautiful as men?

He is confused and too afraid to ask, no one seems to help, and all these days he doesn't care. Years pass by; he feels alone; he's not fitting in and the smile he had on his face for so long slowly turns around, and he starts crying, and he starts screaming, and finally he begins dreaming.

He eventually turns ten; he gets a phone, a smart one, it can call, it can sing, it can talk, and it can bring him the answers to all his questions. He uses Google and finally finds out, why he doesn't fit and why he doesn't love.

He makes a decision, but he's not sure. Telling everyone? Will they cry? Will they hate? Will they celebrate? He doesn't know he does not care because all these years he was sitting here. He was crying. He was hating. But one thing he wasn't and that's for sure: celebrating.

He comes out. He really does it, and what was the reaction? He was so sure. She cried, and he started punching. He isn't accepted here anymore. He is just sixteen but got kicked out. He lives on the street with a rainbow wristband around his arm. He wears it proud. It makes him strong. And finally, another proud man comes along.

He is smiling because the stranger sits down and tells him the story about his life. How he got beaten. How he was crying. How his life was just so bad. He told him there was hope. They are not alone. A parade was just walking right next to his cardboard home.

He led the two, and they arrived at the parade with so much pride. They fell in love, and they made out. They got a job and bought a house. And finally, there was the news. People like them they were allowed to do what everyone else could do, they could marry what they three weeks later would simply do. No one could hurt them, they were strong.[/i]

[url=http://ohnotheydidnt.livejournal.com/102472732.html][b][color=white]YouTuber Puts T-Mobile on Blast[/color][/b][/url]
The popular YouTube channel known as H3h3Productions released a video on July 8 2016, in where they explained the predicament they were in a few days ago. In the last year, many hacking groups have gained the public attention by hacking social media accounts of popular YouTubers. H3h3Productions seems to have fell victim for this, but the hackers did not succeed. The video explains that these hackers social engineer into the victim's phone company to obtain their SIM card which contains virtually anything these hackers need such as two factor authentication information and personal phone data to make these hacks possible. The hackers were able to obtain the victim's SIM card, but was later deactivated by T-Mobile when Ethan, owner of H3h3Productions, called them explaining the situation. In the video, Ethan mentions the fact that they are potentially looking to sue T-Mobile for their lack in customer security as literally anyone could fall victim to this hack.

[url=http://hollywoodlife.com/2016/07/06/pokemon-go-servers-down-game-launches-androidios-fans-react/][b][color=white]Pokémon Go Servers Offline Immediately After Debut[/color][/b][/url]
On July 6, 2016, Pokémon Go was officially released in the United States on iOS and Android devices. The game is a little unique in itself. In your normal Pokémon game, you would be playing on a console to catch your Pokémon, but this game is a little different. The application sends people out to locations and places Pokémon at places, in the real world. By using your smartphone's camera, tracking your location, and other algorithms, you are now able to go out on a walk to catch your favorite Pokémon. However, a few hours after the initial debut in the United States, the servers for the application went offline which led many people to become angry, but also led to a lot of memes being posted on social media. The servers came online and downtime has not been an issue since this incident.

[url=https://twitter.com/i/moments/751548750770925568][b][color=white]Dallas Come Together to Show Love for Their Police Officers[/color][/b][/url]
On July 7, 2016, an open protest for the two recent events involving the deaths of two African-American men by police was in progress, until it was abruptly stopped by the sounds of gun shots. Nearing the end of the protest, there was a sniper from above picking officers out, which led to 12 officers being shot and five of them fatally injured. The days following this shooting has not only brought more heartache in the world, but it also helped create a stronger Dallas. On July 8, 2016, the people of Dallas united for a #DallasStrong, the hashtag used on Twitter, rally. Despite these events being so tragic, it always so beautiful to see people to drop everything and be together, as one, in these desperate times.
